oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Forage voucher for abstract
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. Users are solely responsible for determining the existence of such instances and for obtaining any other permissions and paying associated fees that may be necessary for the intended use.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Forage; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Confederate States of America -- Quartermaster General's Office; Confederate States of America -- Army -- Supplies and stores; Vouchers; Receipts
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One-page handwritten form, designated Form No. 33, Voucher for Abstract G, reflects the requisition for a month's forage for one private horse in the service of the Confederate States Army, along with the receipt or voucher information indicating that the requisition for forage by Major J. J. Lamb of the 5th Tennessee was filled by Regimental Quartermaster J. E. Ray. This voucher will be recorded on Abstract G, possibly with additional forms representing financial transactions.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America. Quartermaster General's Office
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In terms of Civil War quartermaster documentation, vouchers represent the actual exchanges that are happening in the field. As one moves up the chain of document organization from Voucher to Abstract to Report or Return, one is stepping further and further away from the recorded individual transaction.
